  2. Changing the Content of <title> Tag

Changing the Content of <title> TagÂ¶

In the provided HTML file, line number 6 will be the focus of this lesson.

 1<!doctype html>
 2<html lang="en">
 3<head>
 4    <meta charset="utf-8">
 5    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
 6    <title>St. Joseph's Computer Club</title>
 7    <link rel="icon" type="image/x-icon"
 8    href="../assets/images/favicon.ico">
 9    <link href="../assets/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
10    <link href="css/mystyle.css" rel="stylesheet">
11</head>
12<body>
13    <div class="container">
14        <h1>Page header</h1>
15        <p>
16            This is my test paragraph...
17        </p>
18        <a href="../index.html">
19            Click to go back to the front page...
20        </a>
21    </div>
22<!-- In this section, we will not learn about these (script) tags. -->
23<script src="../assets/js/bootstrap.bundle.min.js"></script>
24<script src="../assets/js/anime.min.js"></script>
25<script src="js/myjs.js"></script>
26</body>
27</html>

On line 6, please change your <title> element similar to the following:

<title>Abc's Page</title>

Please replace Abc with your first nameâ€”such as Conor, Emmet, Harry, etc.,â€”as appropriate.

Warning

Please refrain from using your full name to replace Abc.

Do you know where you find your title content when you open the file on a browser?
